documents.document: Without meaning to, Jared Kushner accidentally convinces President Trump that ACLU lawyers are international bankers. Ivanka's bodyguard sloughs off its skin.
While playing chess, Rick Snyder fails to convince President Trump that Trump's in-laws are not that horny. Peter Thiel quotes Judith Butler.
A delirious Marco Rubio decides not to tell President Trump that Tea Party Patriots are alcoholics. Adam Sandler tries MDMA.
In a lengthy montage, Rick Scott fails to convince Katrina Pierson that the caterers are filing a lawsuit. God Almighty cheats at cards.
Over hors d'oeuvres, Elaine Chao rudely informs President Trump that Mormons are Schwarzenegger fans. Trump's body double slaughters a lamb on the South Lawn.
During a ritual, Rick Scott divulges to Kellyanne Conway that the hired help are filing a lawsuit. An ambassador learns to sew.
On Monday, Pete Sessions reluctantly admits to President Trump that the voters are building the wall. Barry Goldwater's ghost throws a dildo.
Via text message, Paul Ryan calmly tells Katrina Pierson that Teen Vogue reporters are moving into Trump Tower. An adorable orphan learns to knit.
At a bar mitzvah, Rand Paul admits to Melania that neo-Nazis are disciples of Cthulhu. Sean Hannity has a one-night stand.
On Monday, Mitch McConnell persuades Katrina Pierson that government employees are faithful conservatives. Glenn Beck insults Ronald Reagan.
At a quinceaÃ±era, Rick Scott mistakenly tells Kellyanne Conway that Lyft and Uber are not very affluent. Michelle Malkin falls off a ladder.
During a ritual, Lamar Alexander explains to President Trump that ACLU lawyers are open to dialogue. Tila Tequila smells something nasty.
On Tuesday, Lamar Smith boldly informs President Trump that those guys are waiting in the Lincoln bedroom. The maid pretends to be an alien.
After a speech, John Kasich politely tells Melania that Nordstroms employees are feminists. A local TV anchor finds a cursed sword.
During Festivus, Lamar Alexander reluctantly admits to Melania that abortion doctors are clamoring for attention. Trump Junior downloads an app.
Before breakfast, Jared Kushner decides not to tell Omarosa Manigault that Trump's sons are very affordable. Jeffrey Lord tries acid.
While playing chess, Nikki Haley informs Katrina Pierson that civil rights activists are in covert ops. Stacey Dash removes the mask.
After too many drinks, John Kasich explains to President Trump that some voters are in on the joke. Sean Hannity wears a fake mustache.
On Easter, Hope Hicks overhears someone tell Rick Perry that those girls are cannibals. Newt Gingrich wins an arm-wrestling contest.
In the West Wing, Sean Spicer divulges to President Trump that European immigrants are filing another lawsuit. Clint Eastwood dodges indictment.
On a long hike, Louie Gohmert accidentally convinces Rick Perry that Russian agents are total winners. Adriana Cohen gets an extreme makeover.
A stone-faced Liz Cheney calmly tells Kellyanne Conway that Kremlin officials are enlightened leaders. The White House chef quotes the Bible.
On a three-way call, Scott Pruitt reluctantly admits to Kellyanne Conway that AARP members are untrustworthy. James Caan cleans up after the party.
On Air Force One, Rex Tillerson tells Jeff Sessions that convicts are dropping candy wrappers. Dana Perino gives a Roman salute.
An incensed Matt Bevin persuades Omarosa Manigault that agnostics are victims of a misunderstanding. Scott Walker gets subpoenaed.
While lifting weights, Hope Hicks confesses to Omarosa Manigault that leftist college students are waiting at Trump Tower. James Caan slowly gets undressed.
At a playground, Rick Scott convinces Ben Carson that unicorns are ruining "The Apprentice." Lou Dobbs has to pay the bill.
As part of a hazing ritual, Steve Bannon overhears someone tell Melania that the kids are dropping candy wrappers. Mike Tyson switches parties.
At a strip club, Carly Fiorina overhears someone tell Kellyanne Conway that Asian immigrants are hiding in Trump Tower. A "fixer" rides in Marine One.
In a lengthy montage, H.R. McMaster convinces Katrina Pierson that those girls are withdrawing support. Erick Erickson is sealed in a casket.
During a meeting, H.R. McMaster carefully explains to Betsy DeVos that CIA agents are refusing to cooperate. Carl Higbie works the door.
After a rally, Lamar Smith informs Jeff Sessions that the McCains are hiding in Trump Tower. Victoria Jackson gets kicked out.
After the two argue, John Kasich overhears someone tell Melania that the New York Mets are waiting in the Lincoln bedroom. Peter Thiel finally takes a shower.
While sunbathing, General Mattis tries to convince President Trump that WSJ reporters are drains on public coffers. Erick Erickson is thrown in Guantanamo.
A sweaty Lamar Smith calmly tells Jeff Sessions that prisoners are standing in the kitchen. The gardener guest stars.
At the Pentagon, Rick Snyder politely tells Katrina Pierson that the voters are not really important. Alex Jones screams incoherently.
As part of a scheme, Paul Ryan confesses to Rick Perry that Congressional pages are deserving of a tax cut. An obnoxious neighbor barely escapes an angry mob.
At a diner, Ted Cruz tries to convince Betsy DeVos that Iraqi refugees are on point. A man in a yellow cloak quotes Judith Butler.
In Los Angeles, Sam Brownback calmly tells President Trump that Russian spies are drug addicts. David Brooks endorses Trump.
During a bender, Roger Stone tries to persuade President Trump that the in-laws are not real. Scottie Nell Hughes goes vegan.
An intense Steve Bannon proclaims to President Trump that Teen Vogue reporters are supporters of Brexit. Lou Dobbs plugs a leak.
In Los Angeles, Louie Gohmert informs Rick Perry that the kids are phishing .gov email accounts. Sarah Palin gets an ulcer.
On a hot mic, Paul LePage reluctantly explains to Rick Perry that felons are spies. Adriana Cohen quotes Plato.
While lifting weights, Butch Otter patiently explains to President Trump that red state governors are dropping big hints. The White House chef
After a sleepless night, General Mattis divulges to President Trump that NAACP members are calling for impeachment. The butler shoplifts a coat.
As part of a scheme, Liz Cheney tells Rick Perry that Scientologists are requesting donations. An ex-girlfriend has to pay the bill.
At Camp David, Jared Kushner tries to convince President Trump that New Yorkers are victims of a misunderstanding. Peggy Noonan gets amnesia.
With gritted teeth, H.R. McMaster reveals to Omarosa Manigault that skeptics are totally trustworthy. Jeffrey Lord rides in Air Force One.
An indifferent Darrell Issa reveals to Omarosa Manigault that their Twitter followers are making America great again. George Will shares a joint.
In the basement, Wilbur Ross fails to convince President Trump that FBI agents are hunting dolphins. Erick Erickson takes copious notes.
On a hot mic, Lamar Smith convinces President Trump that pool reporters are disciples of Cthulhu. Adriana Cohen goes vegetarian.
On Twitter, Wilbur Ross divulges to Jeff Sessions that KGB spies are not to be trusted. Jon Voight learns the art of fisticuffs.
An angry Steven Mnuchin reveals to President Trump that drug dealers are coming for dinner. Trump's bodyguard picks a booger.
After a long meeting, Lamar Smith mistakenly tells Rick Perry that Tumblr users are using TOR to evade detection. Bill Kristol discreetly applies for other jobs.
An angry Peter King announces to Omarosa Manigault that Chinese officials are selling Girl Scout cookies. James Woods goes to the grocery.
While soaking wet, Liz Cheney rudely informs President Trump that several dictators are alcoholics. David Brooks gets a swastika tattoo.
In a panic, Jared Kushner accidentally convinces Rick Perry that millennials are potential allies. Sarah Palin snorts a few lines.
After a sleepless night, Wilbur Ross insists to Jeff Sessions that Russian agents are not very affluent. A mysterious man creates an international incident.
A delirious Justin Amash proclaims to President Trump that several dictators are actually gay. Larry the Cable Guy leaves suddenly.
At a bar mitzvah, Jared Kushner carefully explains to Kellyanne Conway that bisexuals are fiercely loyal. Karl Rove uses Comic Sans.
During a meeting, Mitch McConnell persuades President Trump that Native Americans are releasing Trump's tax returns. Peggy Noonan jumps off the roof.
At a strip club, Hope Hicks decides not to tell President Trump that socialists are alcoholics. Tucker Carlson quotes Chomsky.
In front of diplomats, Ryan Zinke explains to Katrina Pierson that Scientologists are refusing to cooperate. Ann Coulter learns how to let go.
A paranoid Mitch McConnell tries to persuade President Trump that Nation of Islam members are on point. Dana Perino does an AMA on reddit.
Over dinner, Steve Scalise carefully explains to President Trump that union members are not reading Breitbart. Bill Kristol reads a book.
On Facebook, Matt Bevin overhears someone tell President Trump that small business owners are dangerous. Trump Junior kisses a woman.
In a bonus episode, Liz Cheney informs President Trump that poets are headed to prison. A lovable old man puts on very tight pants.
In a flashback, Lamar Smith convinces President Trump that liberal activists are filing frivolous lawsuits. Karl Rove quotes Plato.
On Friday, Rick Scott tells Katrina Pierson that the kids are filing another lawsuit. Kayleigh McEnany fails the Turing test.
An incensed Darrell Issa fails to persuade Katrina Pierson that AARP members are really good at dancing. Alex Jones fails the Voight-Kampff test.
With clenched fists, John Kasich tries to persuade President Trump that Kentuckians are total winners. A mysterious man rides in Air Force One.
A younger version of Lindsey Graham announces to President Trump that liberal activists are dangerous. Barry Goldwater's ghost picks flowers and sighs deeply.
In a confusing mixup, Rick Snyder overhears someone tell Jeff Sessions that Asian immigrants are crushed by excessive regulations. President Bush
Without meaning to, Liz Cheney accidentally convinces President Trump that virgins are selling Girl Scout cookies. Kayleigh McEnany tweets compulsively.
Covered in rashes, Sean Spicer boldly informs Rick Perry that Zoroastrians are tormented by excessive regulations. Clint Eastwood calls a cab.
On Friday, Peter King boldly informs Jeff Sessions that NBC reporters are digging holes in the yard. God Almighty warms up the audience.
While soaking wet, Sean Spicer reluctantly admits to President Trump that Syrian refugees are fake news. Peggy Noonan quotes Chomsky.
During their morning jog, Jeb Bush overhears someone tell President Trump that school teachers are fans of TrumpCare. Don King checks out Grindr.
A grinning Ryan Zinke convinces President Trump that the voters are probably contagious. Michael Savage goes shopping.
In a flashback, Mitch McConnell announces to President Trump that small business owners are not what they seem. Ivanka's bodyguard goes into mourning.
During a bender, Wilbur Ross politely tells Jeff Sessions that the New Black Panthers are unusually angry this week. A lovable old man tweets compulsively.
While wrestling, Ivanka accidentally convinces President Trump that those girls are hilarious. Trump Junior mixes paint incorrectly.
Late at night, Peter King informs President Trump that the IT guys are always strapped. Peggy Noonan quotes Dostoyevsky.
At a playground, Louie Gohmert tells Jeff Sessions that red state governors are very affordable. God Almighty punches a wall.
During a blackout, Rex Tillerson informs Betsy DeVos that the Clintons are indebted to Satan. Barry Goldwater's ghost is torn apart by a mob.
On a conference call, Lamar Alexander mistakenly tells Rick Perry that the New England Patriots are organizing resistance. Tila Tequila goes vegetarian.
At a diner, Roger Stone carefully explains to Omarosa Manigault that the caterers are immortal. Rush Limbaugh helps.
In front of the press, Justin Amash divulges to Omarosa Manigault that Protestants are coming for dinner. Pat Buchanan develops a twitch.
While playing chess, Lindsey Graham confesses to Betsy DeVos that ATF agents are really good at dancing. Corey Lewandowski kills a baby seal.
On Thanksgiving, Ryan Zinke tries to convince President Trump that Hollywood liberals are particularly smelly. A "fixer" wears pajamas.
In front of tourists, Justin Amash rudely informs Rick Perry that the backup dancers are hiding in Trump Tower. Jon Voight learns what love is.
During a bender, Lindsey Graham divulges to President Trump that squirrels are still alive. Chris Christie is the prime suspect.
During yoga, Steve Bannon informs Ben Carson that ISIS soldiers are not good with computers. Melania's bodyguard tries on new outfits.
A polite Sam Brownback insists to President Trump that black politicians are tying up the phone lines. Pat Buchanan finds change in the couch.
In a panic, Jason Chaffetz carefully explains to President Trump that kinksters are not really important. A corporate lobbyist uses the wrong door.
During their morning jog, Pete Sessions calmly tells President Trump that several Senators are advocates for secession. Dana Perino finds a purse.
During a ritual, Steve Bannon decides not to tell President Trump that bisexuals are not really worth the time. Alex Jones warms up the audience.
While drunk, Jared Kushner reluctantly admits to President Trump that Asian immigrants are planning something ominous. Jeffrey Lord pukes in Trump's lap.
Via text message, Paul LePage admits to President Trump that Amazon and Walmart are actually pretty decent. Dana Perino goes vegan.
When the power goes out, Hope Hicks admits to Jeff Sessions that the kids are big league. A local TV anchor eats the entire cake.
